Total student funding

£8,006,230

Total retention adjustment breakdown
Retention adjustment Sub-total
Total student funding £8,006,230
Adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students (retention factor) 0.97022
Total adjustment based on withdrawing students -£242,669
How adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students is calculated

Retained students from October 2020 return (R14) ÷ total funded students = proportion of continuing or completed students

(Proportion of completing or continuing students ÷ 2) + 0.5 = adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students

Total programme cost weighting uplift breakdown
Programme cost weighting uplift Calculation Sub-total
Programme cost weighting 1.05618
Total student funding after retention adjustment
Calculation: Multiply 		Multiply £7,763,561
Total student funding after retention adjustment
Calculation: Minus 		Minus £7,763,561
Total adjustment for subjects that cost more to deliver
Calculation: Equals 		Equals £435,380
Where programme cost weighting comes from

The weighting is based on the sector subject area classification for each student’s core aim. It is calculated using data from the October 2020 return (R14).

Total level 3 maths and English payment £87,590
Where proportion of students comes from

This is the proportion of students who have not achieved grade 4, C or higher in GCSE maths or English averaged between the 2 subjects.

It's calculated using data from the October 2020 return (R14).

Places: 2
Rate: £6,000 		2 £6,000 £12,000
Total high needs
Places: 31 		31 £186,000
Where place numbers come from

Place numbers are either rolled forward from 2020 to 2021 or your local authority agreed it with ESFA. This provides a base level of funding.

You must agree additional funding above this level with your local authority. Local authorities pay you the top-up funding directly. It is not shown in this statement.

Total discretionary bursary fund £177,806
Where instances per student comes from

It is calculated using student’s home postcode from the October 2020 return (R14) and the index of multiple deprivation 2015.

Adjusted discretionary bursary fund - transition to new methodology

ESFA is moving to a new methodology to calculate discretionary bursary fund. During the transition, you will receive at least 75% of that amount and up to 125%.

Where qualifying students come from

If you have 1 to 10 qualifying students, we will fund you for 10 students. If you have 11 to 20 qualifying students, we will fund you for 20 students.
